instances.text: SPAN_V 404-A_101 - From World to Screen: Topics in Hispanic Cinema (A)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Los films sern el punto de partida para abordar cuestiones esenciales de la vida de Espaa en este perodo: por ejemplo, cuestiones sobre la memoria, la identidad nacional o regional; o asuntos relativos al individuo y la sociedad espaola en el contexto global.
See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/SPAN404a 

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

Language of instruction: Spanish

instances.text: SPPH_V 401-001 - Basic Epidemiology for Infection Control

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
This course is designed to explore fundamental concepts in epidemiology, biostatistics for epidemiology, study design and analysis and outbreak investigation as it applies to institutional infection control. The entire course will be delivered online in a problem-based learning format. For detailed course information, please visit the following webpage: https://pathology.ubc.ca/educational-programs/infection-prevention-and-control-certificate/courses/path477-spph401/ .

Registration is restricted AND only SPPH students may request permission to attend. There is a limit of 15 seats available in total. Please contact the instructor, Dr. Monika Naus, directly for permission (monika.naus@bccdc.ca) and forward your permission to spph.graduate-programs@ubc.ca

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
As of June 13, 2024, the course is full. There is a waitlist of 10 spaces. The waitlist is also full. If you cannot see the waitlist option, then the waitlist is full. Students may keep an eye on the system in case room opens up on the waitlist. The instructors and SPPH do not keep a manual waitlist for the course. 

Special note for Indigenous students: if you cannot register into the course yourself, please contact the instructors to get registered. Instructors: Melanie Rivers (melanie.rivers@ubc.ca) and Drew St. Laurent (drew.stlaurent@ubc.ca). In addition to the 45 seat enrollment limit, there are up to 5 seats reserved for Indigenous students.

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
